intro: Argyroderma villetii, commonly known as the silverleaf tree, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its silvery-white undersides on its leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The tree is often found in dry, arid environments and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
